text: “Self-care is how you take your power back.”
author: Lalah Delia

text: “The most powerful relationship you will ever have is the relationship with yourself.”
author: Steve Maraboli

text: “Self-care is not a luxury, it’s a necessity.”
author: Anonymous

text: “Nourishing yourself in a way that helps you blossom in the direction you want to go is attainable, and you are worth the effort.”
author: Deborah Day

text: “Almost everything will work if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.”
author: Anne Lamott

text: “You can’t pour from an empty cup. Take care of yourself first.”
author: Anonymous

text: “Love yourself enough to set boundaries. Your time and energy are precious. You get to choose how you use it. You teach people how to treat you by deciding what you will and won’t accept.”
author: Anna Taylor

text: “Self-compassion is simply giving the same kindness to ourselves that we would give to others.”
author: Christopher Germer

text: “Rest when you’re weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.”
author: Ralph Marston

text: “Self-care is giving the world the best of you, instead of what’s left of you.”
author: Katie Reed

text: “You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.”
author: Buddha

text: “Self-love is the source of all other loves.”
author: Pierre Corneille

text: “You can’t take care of anyone else unless you first take care of yourself.”
author: Michael Hyatt

text: “Remember always that you not only have the right to be an individual, you have an obligation to be one.”
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: “Self-care is not about self-indulgence, it’s about self-preservation.”
author: Audre Lorde

text: “To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.”
author: Oscar Wilde

text: “The most important relationship is the one you have with yourself.”
author: Diane Von Furstenberg

text: “Caring for myself is not self-indulgence, it is self-preservation, and that is an act of political warfare.”
author: Audre Lorde

text: “When you recover or discover something that nourishes your soul and brings joy, care enough about yourself to make room for it in your life.”
author: Jean Shinoda Bolen

text: “Taking care of yourself is the most powerful way to begin to take care of others.”
author: Bryant McGill

text: “Be kinder to yourself. And then let your kindness flood the world.”
author: Pema Chödrön

text: “Self-care is not a one-time event, it’s a lifelong practice.”
author: Anonymous

text: “Self-care is how we give ourselves permission to pause.”
author: Cecilia Tran

text: “You can’t control everything. Sometimes you just need to relax and have faith that things will work out. Let go a little and just let life happen.”
author: Kody Keplinger

text: “If you don’t take care of yourself, the universe won’t.”
author: Jim Rohn

text: “Self-care is how you take your power back.”
author: Lalah Delia

text: “To be kind to others, you must first be kind to yourself.”
author: Anonymous

text: “When you recover or discover something that nourishes your soul and brings joy, care enough about yourself to make room for it in your life.”
author: Jean Shinoda Bolen

text: You owe yourself the love that you so freely give to other people.
author: Unknown

text: The most powerful relationship you will ever have is the relationship with yourself.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Self-care is not selfish. You cannot serve from an empty vessel.
author: Eleanor Brown

text: You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
author: Buddha

text: Loving yourself isn't vanity. It's sanity.
author: Katrina Mayer

text: Nourishing yourself in a way that helps you blossom in the direction you want to go is attainable, and you are worth the effort.
author: Deborah Day

text: Self-care is how you take your power back.
author: Lalah Delia

text: Self-love is the source of all our other loves.
author: Pierre Corneille

text: Put yourself at the top of your to-do list every single day and the rest will fall into place.
author: Unknown

text: Self-compassion is simply giving the same kindness to ourselves that we would give to others.
author: Christopher Germer

text: The relationship with yourself sets the tone for every other relationship you have.
author: Jane Travis

text: Be gentle with yourself, you're doing the best you can.
author: Unknown

text: Invest in yourself. You can afford it. Trust me.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Self-care is not a waste of time. Self-care makes your use of time more sustainable.
author: Jackie Viramontez

text: When we give ourselves compassion, we are opening our hearts in a way that can transform our lives.
author: Kristin Neff

text: Nurturing yourself is not selfish – it’s essential to your survival and your well-being.
author: Renee Peterson Trudeau

text: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line.
author: Lucille Ball

text: Self-care is not a luxury, it's a necessity.
author: Unknown

text: Self-care is giving the world the best of you, instead of what's left of you.
author: Katie Reed

text: Self-love is not selfish; you cannot truly love another until you know how to love yourself.
author: Unknown

text: Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.
author: Ralph Marston

text: There is enough time for self-care. There is not enough time to make up for the life you'll miss by not filling yourself up.
author: Jennifer Williamson

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Self-care is the greatest gift you can give your family and the world.
author: Unknown

text: When we take care of ourselves, we're better equipped to care for those we love.
author: Unknown

text: Self-care is the key to a happy and fulfilling life.
author: Unknown

text: Rest and self-care are so important. When you take time to replenish your spirit, it allows you to serve others from the overflow.
author: Eleanor Brown

text: Self-love is the best love.
author: Unknown

text: Self-care is a deliberate choice to gift yourself with people, places, things, events, and opportunities that recharge our personal battery and promote whole health – body, mind, and spirit.
author: Laurie Buchanan

text: Self-care is how we give ourselves permission to be our best selves.
author: Unknown
